note: He has held previous positions at University of Pittsburgh, University of Houston, and Texas A&M. He is a fellow of the Econometric Society.
title: Kagel is University Chaired Professor of Applied Economics and Director of the Economics Laboratory at The Ohio State University. He has published widely in leading economic, psychology and political science journals on topics ranging from group versus individual behavior in strategic interactions, auctions, legislative bargaining, and individual choice

container-title: Together with Lloyd Shapley, he shared the 2012 Nobel memorial prize in Economics. Together with John Kagel he edited the 1995 Handbook of Experimental Economics
title: Roth is the McCaw Professor of Economics at Stanford and the Gund Professor of Economics and Business Administration Emeritus at Harvard. He earlier taught at the University of Pittsburgh and the University of Illinois

container-title: He is past president of the Economic Science Association and Society for Neuroeconomics
note: and received a MacArthur Fellowship in 2013.
title: Camerer is the Robert Kirby Professor of Behavioral Economics at Caltech, California. He specializes in applying diverse methods from psychology and neuroscience to test theories of choices, games, and markets experimentally. He also uses field data to test theories from behavioral economics

container-title: He is a recipient of the American Psychological Association Distinguished Scientific Contribution Award and a Fellow of the American Psychological Society and the American Association for the Advancement of Science
title: Professor of Psychology, and Co-Director of the Princeton Neuroscience Institute at Princeton University. He studies the human capacity for cognitive control—the ability to pursue goal-directed behavior in the face of distraction or interference—and its disturbance in psychiatric disorders. His work draws on a combination of behavioral, human brain–imaging, computational modeling, and mathematical analysis methods to identify and characterize the neural mechanisms underlying cognitive control

note: His work in experimental economics has focused on learning, play by teams, communication, and coordination. Cooper serves as editor-in-chief for Experimental Economics.
title: Cooper holds the Brim Eminent Scholar Chair in economics at Florida State University in Tallahassee, Florida, and serves as chair of the executive committee for xs/fs, the experimental social sciences cluster at FSU. Previously he has held appointments at the University of East Anglia, Case Western Reserve University, and the University of Pittsburgh
